item.title: UFO sightings in South Africa
item.description:
List of Alleged UFO Sightings in South Africa ðŸ”—

This article documents reported sightings of Unidentified Flying Objects (UFOs) in South Africa.

1914 Phantom Monoplanes ðŸ”—

This section details a series of sightings from August to September 1914, where numerous South Africans reported seeing a nighttime monoplane. These sightings occurred during the lead-up to the South West Africa campaign of World War I, leading to speculation that it was a German spy plane. However, the origin of the plane remained unknown, leading some to consider mass hysteria as a possible explanation. Key locations include various parts of South Africa.

1970s Sighting ðŸ”—

This section focuses on an incident from June 26, 1971, involving Bennie Smit, a farm owner near Fort Beaufort in the Eastern Cape. Smit and local police reportedly fired shots at a fireball-like object that changed color. Rumors circulated about an army investigation, though no records were found. The incident gained international attention, and local businesses capitalized on the event.

1990s Sightings ðŸ”—

This section covers several UFO sightings during the 1990s:

  • April 7, 1991: A family in Baviaanspoort, Pretoria, reported a triangular craft with red and white lights. Similar sightings occurred in nearby Eersterust.
  • November 18, 1993: Residents of Sasolburg observed lights moving from Vereeniging, describing a craft that could change color and shape.
  • Septemberâ€“October 1994: A farmer in Warrenton claimed to see a ‘mothership’ with a distinctive engine sound.
  • Marchâ€“April 1995: A UFO flap occurred across South Africa, with reports including a hovering object at De Brug, a spacecraft blocking a road near Coligny, and disruptions to vehicles and watches.
  • August 28, 1996: Police Sgt. Nico Stander in Pretoria videotaped lights in the sky, leading to a chase involving police and a helicopter near Cullinan.
  • July 1997: Andreas Mathios claimed to film a cylindrical light above Trichardt.
  • May 8, 2000: Police inspector Kriel reported observing an orange, oval-shaped light on the N3 freeway near Warden.

21st Century ðŸ”—

This section details UFO sightings in the 2000s and beyond:

  • June 27, 2004: Roshnie Naidu in Durban reported observing and videotaping a bright, colorful light changing shape.
  • 2009: Multiple people witnessed orange-red objects traveling between Middelburg and Witbank.
  • July 21â€“22, 2010: Residents of Booysens, Pretoria, reported seeing a triangle of bright lights.
  • Mayâ€“October 2011: Numerous reports of silent, orange lights over Tierpoort and Krugersdorp, with additional sightings near Harrismith.
  • November 2015: Residents in Pietermaritzburg and Clarendon reported seeing orange orbs, and a green light was reported over Long Street in Cape Town.
  • December 12, 2016: The captain and co-pilot of a Boeing 737 cargo aircraft reported seeing a glowing green object near Jeffreys Bay.

Crash Claims and Hoaxes ðŸ”—

This section addresses claims of alien spacecraft being shot down by South African aircraft in 1989 and 1995, which were later determined to be hoaxes.
